title: Six Flags Hotels
text:
Expert Videos Mark Kahler, licensed to About.com 
Six Flags hotels tend to offer specials connected with nearby the nearby park. But many times, you must pay for the convenience of being next door to all the fun. 
It sometimes pays to drive a few miles. But chances are good that at the end of the day, you'll be tired. Fighting through a lot of heavy traffic across many miles might not be a good idea. 
With all of that in mind, here are some places to check near 11 Six Flags parks for reasonable prices and short driving distances. 
An attempt was made here to provide at least one low-budget choice and one mid-range ($100-$125/night) option. But most of the choices here should come in under $100 per night before taxes and fees. 
Keep in mind these are not endorsements for the Six Flags hotels, merely starting points in your research. Check each option carefully and remember that during holidays, many of these hotels will fill up quickly.
